title: Set up Forgejo â†” GitHub bidirectional sync
description: Configure bidirectional git sync between Forgejo (primary) and GitHub (mirror). Forgejo is deployed in apexalgo-iad cluster. GitHub provides external visibility and CI/CD. Sync should be automatic on push to either repo. See ADR-014 and ADR-028.

title: Implement multi-repo support in agent runners
description: Update runners to support multiple git repositories for agent definitions. Implement repos.json configuration, multi-repo config loader, find_agent_config with config_source lookup, and parallel git clone/pull. Update Hub database schema with config_source, config_path, config_branch columns. See ADR-014 and ADR-028 for details.

title: Implement config cache invalidation webhook
description: Add webhook endpoint for cache invalidation when agent configs change. Runners cache configs with TTL, but immediate invalidation needed for urgent changes. Webhook should invalidate Redis/Valkey cache and trigger git pull. See ADR-028.

title: Document agent registration and deployment workflow
description: Create comprehensive documentation for: 1) How to define new agents in Forgejo, 2) Registration process (automated vs manual), 3) Storing API keys in Kubernetes secrets, 4) Deploying runners with agent access. Should include examples and troubleshooting. See ADR-014, ADR-006, ADR-028.

title: Update registration script to support multi-repo sources
description: Update scripts/register_agents.py to accept multiple --repo arguments, track config_source for each agent, and register agents with config_source/config_path/config_branch fields in Hub. Support repos from different git providers with different auth methods. See ADR-014.

title: Implement automated config validation in CI
description: Add GitHub Actions/Forgejo Actions workflow to validate agent configs on push. Should check YAML syntax, schema validation, and required fields. Prevents invalid configs from being merged. See ADR-014 and ADR-028.

title: Implement automated agent registration in CI/CD
description: Currently agent registration is manual via scripts/register_agents.py. Implement automated registration in GitHub Actions/Forgejo Actions that runs on push to agent-definitions repo. Should validate configs, register new agents, and securely store API keys. See ADR-014 for details.

title: Implement API key rotation mechanism
description: Create automated API key rotation for agents. Should allow scheduled rotation with zero-downtime updates. Rotation endpoint exists (/api/v1/agents/me/regenerate-key) but needs automation and secret management integration. See ADR-006 for details.
